text: I've always found it interesting that Simon's Quest is widely panned, yet it is a Metroidvania, and almost all the Castlevania games after it are Metroidvanias.  I guess that it was ahead of its time, and didn't end up perfect like Nocturne in the Moonlight.
author: Myriachan

text: 'What a horrible non-skippable message box every 5 minutes.'
author: Matthew Fry

text:
That's kind of true I guess. I just loved the feeling of roaming the countryside of a land that was really fucked up by a presence that you know was coming, but you really didn't fully know what to expect. 

It felt like much more of an adventure and somewhat grander in scope than many other entries

author: McBuffenFitness

text:
I promised that if I went through your whole list, I would subscribe to your channel. After many months of trying the on and off method of going through the lengthy list, I realized I would probably never reach the end this way, as you update so frequently.
Knowing this, I spent half a day going through the rest of your list, getting the soundtracks of multiple games along the way, until I finally reached this video. Reaching the end of this journey, I conclude it by subscribing to your channel.
author: Kyrk

text:
I've been saying for the longest time that I wish they'd revisit the Castlevania 2 formula, but I really doubt they will. Castlevania 2 was the first in the series I ever played and it's still my favourite on the NES. 

So much time was spent on trial and error, but neither it nor  the "what a horrible night to have a curse" messages people crab about ever really bothered me. It did have flaws, but it was trying something new, and I'd say it was still mostly successful.

text: Loved this game. Sure it had some well known flaws, but it had such a perfectly gloomy atmosphere. That and the few tracks the soundtrack has are all memorable. I do admit I was bummed by Dracula's empty castle and how easy he was. Still, an overall great and unique experience.
